raw_comment:
Newspapers try to offer headlines that grab the reader's attention.  They tend to be shorter and have a zing -- something that the reader would not expect.  Maybe it surprises the reader with either surprise or shock.
Always the headlines come from evidence in the graph and not other information or opinion.  
What do you propose?
ace_sentences: These headlines grab the reader's attention.
These headlines tend to be short.
A zing is something that a reader does not expect.
A headline may surprise a reader.
A headline may shock a reader.
A headline must come from evidence in the graph.
A headline must not come from other information.
A headline must not come from an opinion.
You ask me for a proposal.
